meanings.definition: To provide a commentary or explanation on an event or situation.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the announcer will commentate on the players' strategies.
meanings.sent2: The sports analyst will commentate on the match, explaining each team's tactics.
meanings.sent3: I tried to commentate on my cat's actions as if it were a sports event.
meanings.sent4: She could commentate on the unfolding drama in the office like a seasoned reporter.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to commentate on the historical event as if they were news anchors.

meanings.definition: To serve as a commentator on a broadcast or live event.
meanings.sent1: The former athlete will commentate on the upcoming sports competition.
meanings.sent2: She will commentate on the fashion show, providing insights into the designers' work.
meanings.sent3: My little brother likes to commentate on our family dinners as if he's a TV host.
meanings.sent4: He can commentate on the city's hustle and bustle like a seasoned radio host.
meanings.sent5: The actor was asked to commentate on the award ceremony as if he were a professional presenter.
